title: 107_hr390
content: The Act may be cited as the "COLA Fairness Act of 2001" and includes a provision for a Regional Consumer Price Index. The Bureau of Labor Statistics will establish 14 regions in the United States, each including a specified city. These cities include Atlanta, Boston, Chicago, Cleveland, Dallas, Detroit, Philadelphia, Houston, Los Angeles, Miami, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, and Washington D.C. The Bureau will also establish Regional Consumer Price Indices. The Bureau will establish Regional Consumer Price Indices for each region in the United States, indicating changes in typical consumption expenditures. These provisions will be effective starting from January 1, 2003, with necessary appropriations authorized for implementation. The Social Security cost-of-living increases will be computed according to specific provisions starting from January 1, 2003. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act include changes to the calculation of cost-of-living increases based on the region where an individual resides. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act involve changes to the calculation of cost-of-living adjustments based on the individual's region of residence. The amendments also include conforming adjustments to applicable former laws. The amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act will apply to determinations made by the Commissioner of Social Security regarding cost-of-living computation quarters ending on or after September 30 of the second calendar year following the enactment of this Act. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act include adjustments to the cap amount for accounting years based on changes in the medical care expenditure category of the consumer price index. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating the cap amount for accounting years based on changes in the consumer price index. This includes replacing specific references to the "Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers" with the more general term "applicable consumer price index" in various sections of the Act. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating the cap amount for accounting years based on changes in the consumer price index by replacing specific references with the term "applicable consumer price index" in various sections of the Act. Amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating the cap amount for accounting years based on changes in the consumer price index by adding a new subsection to the Act. The term 'applicable consumer price index' refers to the Regional Consumer Price Index for the region where the person resides or maintains principal offices. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will determine the adjustment based on the index for specific individuals. The amendments apply to determinations made for periods ending after the effective date.
